content:
er 16, 2013
												UPDATE 28-04-2014So I haven't been very active within Blockland and only recently I've learned that Return to Blockland has been shutdown since February. Well, bugger. One of the biggest things on this review was RTB's existence.Not to worry! The community has already found ways to circumvent its shutdown and there are backup pages and a whole new chat addon thingy that imitates RTB's.Backups: http://forum.blockland.us/index.php?topic=253292.0IRC Chat: http://forum.blockland.us/index.php?topic=255973.0(I SERIOUSLY hope that Steam doesn't block the links any time soon. If it does, let me know and I'll fix it.)I haven't tested them and I don't have time to. But as far as I can tell, they all look pretty legit.By the way, here's a cool FAQ I've found in case you have any questions: 


Blockland Steam FAQ 
A Guide for Blockland
By: Demian

			Some basic information about Blockland and frequently asked questions that have popped up on the Steam discussion forums.		


//////////////////////////////////////This game might sound cheesy for some people at first glance. "I mean gee, a game where you play with legos online? What is this, people never heard of how bad Roblox turned out to be?!" (Personally I like games where you build stuff very fun, that's why I bought Blockland years ago in the first place...)Oh trust me, it's a lot more than that. This game is like a fusion between Garry's Mod and Legos, but FAR easier to play. You can do pretty much anything in a stylized block world - houses, cities, deathmatches, survival games, racing tracks - and a lot more with its intuitive building and eventing system. Eventing is a sort of very very easy "scripting" within Blockland that you can use to make certain blocks to do certain things from within pre-set lists of actions that you can do to the block for it to do something you want and a lot more. It might seem very overwhelming at first, but when you start playing with it you'll get used to the idea quickly.Building, in my opinion, is a little bit trickier, as you have to move "ghost blocks" around with the numpad (or some other buttons if you're on a numpad-less laptop) and then press enter to deploy a block, and they cannot be floating, nor penetrating the ground or other blocks, unless they are to be built within a Zone Brick which allows you to make actually floating blocks inside of it, so you don't have to make invisible supports for every floating island you might want to do. Buiilding is also very well optimized as you can do a number of moves with the ghost bricks to get them where you want and how you want quickly and efficiently; there exists a macro system where you can "save" the moves you do to a block so you can replicate patterns like stairs and stuff like that without much of a hassle. However, building can be clunky as you have to take blocks from a list to put them in your block selection list - you can only carry up to 10 blocks at a time, I believe. However don't let this limit your creativity, as you can do pretty superb buildings in this game as evidenced by the game's great community - there is lots of support for this game, the developers and its players won't hesitate to help you with any problems you might have with the product, and there are just a LOT of addons in this game that do not allow it to ever be boring, especially with the Return to Blockland addon which is basically a community hub for the game, complete with a chat room, news, and a ton of other addons that are mounted into RTB for easy access, deactivation and (un)installation. RTB can also be downloaded for your server so you can get new Administration features, get the addons of your server listed in the server browser, so the players don't have to download it directly from your server (given they're hosted in RTB), and a few more features.WARNING: Read the update above first. RTB is no longer functional, but there are backups.Making addons for this game is, from what I understand, not tremendously difficult, and as long as you have the talent and willpower to make that one brick you can't find but need, or to make that weapon of your dreams, have a Ferrari in your garage or just a simple addition like a new face for your Blockhead, or maybe a song you want your Music Brick to play, all in all there is no (?) limit to the addons you can make for the game. I wish I could write from experience, but unfortunately, apart from a song or two I didn't make any addons for this game.What I WAS ABLE TO do however was host servers and oh boy, coming from a person who can't ever host servers because of his connection not ever letting people connect, this was a HUGE plus for me. Even the player with the most blocked-off router can host games for their friends and never be hindered by issues like tremendous lag or timeouts, in my experience I found the netcode of Blockland to be very good. At least... I think this is the netcode's doing.The gameplay is very appealing and so are the graphics, as they are very beautiful and, unsurprisingly, very colourful, stylized to look like a cartoon, similar to the likes of TF2, except on legos. Yeah. Graphics for me are very hard to describe. The "maps" (or just... plains) are roughly customizable so they have bodies of water or different types of surfaces, which can spice up the game a bit - I've always liked to build in maps with lots of water.Overall, the game is very enjoyable and on the right servers it can be a ludicrous amount of fun. It is really amazing how such a simple and cheap game like this can provide so many hours of entertainment, from messing around with a few people to doing giant, elaborate buildings, from having mindless fast-paced deathmatch to having class-based capture the flag matches on carefully structured builds and just so much more. Blockland is truly a game for the ages, despite a few flaws like clunky building and some instances of lag when there are too many bricks within a server or when they're being duplicated.I have this game since V12 and now it's on what, Vtwenty-something or so, and from there and now I still recommend it to everybody, kids to adults. The only thing I DIDN'T like is how they got rid of maps in an update months back. Back then you had maps like Bedroom and Kitchen, that were... well, semi-realistic bedrooms and kitchens. I REALLY liked those! But hey, they needed to take a radical action to let the game evolute and that was the end result I suppose...TL;DR: This game is great! Totally recommended! A bit clunky to get started, but you'll get used to it! Lots of addons to help you, client-side and server-side! The graphics are also beautiful!

content:
y 18, 2015
												I love this game but I absolutely cannot recomend it.Don't get the "not reccomended" wrong - this IS a good game. A few years ago I'd definitely have recomended it, but now it's dead. Blockland is a game where 90% of the content is produced by the users in the form of mods. Badspot, for most of Blockland's history, actually helped these modders by modifying the game engine to better suit their creativity. This helped keep the tiny community alive. A service called RTB was released by a game modder called Ephialtes* - it had a friends list, private chat messages, IRC, and allowed people to download mods directly to the game. This is probably the main reason Blockland had any form of community at all.This has changed. Badspot released an update that would remove maps and replaced them with slightly improved graphics. Seems to make sense, since you can just build everything with bricks, right? In actuality, the brick limit is atrociously low** - on the other hand, terrain could be set to loop indefinitely. We were able to get around this by making the terrain on maps and building on top of the terrain. Now, terrain can only be done by one of two methods:    1. Building it with bricks    2. Modular TerrainOption #1 leaves vehicles entierely out of the question, because the vehicle physics are atrocious - they are guaranteed to get stuck over and over again, and there's little to no smooth slopes because bricks are boxy. You CAN make brick terrain look good, but it takes an insane amount of bricks and you'll likely hit the brick limit. You can phase right through a brick if you're going fast enough in a vehicle.Map Terrain vs Brick Terrain: http://i43.tinypic.com/2rc1ulh.png Option #2 is modular terrain, which is bricks that have smooth ramps. Slightly better, but it's ugly as sin and still contrained by the brick limit. You can also phase right through it if you're going fast enough in a vehicle.Modular Terrain: http://pixpipeline.com/s/eaf878362c19.jpgBadspot will NOT fix many of the issues, most notably the ones above. The modding community has practically pushed the game to its limit. Badspot prefers to argue instead of fixing issues. Many of the good people have been driven away. The community has been stripped to a bunch of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ weaboos who crack at least one 9/11 or holocaust joke every two minutes. There's many other problems with this game, but this is how calm criticism is handled at Blockland: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/54466069/banned.pngLastly, and most importantly, Badspot is simply unprofessional -- he accuses the people who don't like the game's development path of being "entitled" - but if anything, Badspot is entitled. These veterans produce most of the game's content in the form of gameplay. They host the game's servers for free. They are where all of the content comes from, and Badspot refuses to update the game to better suit their creative impulses. Blockland would never get anywhere without them.Many major Blockland people have plain left due to these problems. People such as Ephialtes and Kalphiter. This game is great - but now, it's dying.I wish Badspot or really anyone would make some kind of sequel and start all over again and get around the development problems -- I would buy that straight away, and I'm sure the vast majority of the community would too.Do I recomend this game? Unfortunately, I simply can't. *I'm talking about the new RTB, not the original v0002 one. Yes, I know it's technically been around for years but the old RTB has little in common with the current one.**Although the brick limit was raised, it is still atrociously low if you want to have a massive terrain map.

content:
5, 2014
Abandoned by a careless developerFirst:Don't be fooled by the game's trailer. Blockland isn't a lego universe full of fun things to do and intresting people to meet. This game is a trap. I have been playing it since it's earliest days (I was literally one of the first hundred people to buy this game). It was fun at the start when there was still clans and builds and gamemodes were still new and exciting. But it hasn't risen with the times. Nothing new has really been made since 2010. It WAS a very fun game to play, when there was still new things being made and that could be discovered. But nothing like that has happened for this game in a very long time. And with years the community deteroriated to become what it now is today. And the patehtic community of this game only more so worsens it's already near-broken state. Blockland is only kept up and running so Eric can leach more money off it. Little has he done to update it or improve it in any way for a long time. And guess what, he doesn't care. He's literally said multiple times that the only reason he is still giving Blockland even a fraction of his time or effort is because it makes him too much money for him to stop. And when I say a fraction... I truly mean even less than that. He has done nothing and put virtually no effort into improving the game or updating it in any way that the players or the community would appreciate. The game is NOTHING like it is in the trailer. Sure a lot of that stuff shown in the trailer is possible but I can personally garuntee that not a single server being hosted at this time has anything even close to that exciting or unique. The community for this game is virtually nonexistant (unless you're dying to be in a commuinty full of autocratic ♥♥♥♥♥). I have not seen a gaming community full of more hostile and irrational people in my life. This is why all of our servers have nothing good. People on the forums site are pathetic. They do absolutely nothing to upkeep the game or make it better in any way, and spend virtually all of their time ranting on about how the community sucks and making drama threads pointing fingers at users when in reality EVERYONE on the site is doing the exact same thing for the game: NOTHING. Which is why it sucks! :) No, you won't be doing anything like what's in that trailer. Hate to break it to you. Unless you want to spend days learning how to make all of those things yourself and submerge yourself in a community full up stuck up arrogant ♥♥♥♥♥♥, don't buy this game.To the insightful developer comment I recieved below: (This was ORIGINALLY his response, before he changed it to what it is now)Badspot:"So we're looking at a negative review of the Blockland community from someone who aimbots in counter-strike. Nice. Blockland: Generally disliked by cheaters."Last played Counter-Strike: Source: Apr 24, 2011 11:14am1 VAC ban(s) on record	 | Info88 day(s) since last banNice. But, I think not. Recieved the VAC ban from being KL'd, and you can't appeal them. However, I do like how when responding to negative reviews of your product you deviate from actaully addressing ANY of the problems users mention about your game and instead try pinpoint things you find wrong with them to use as leverage against everything that is wrong with YOUR game and how YOU are chosing to manage it. Though it doesn't suprise me in regards to how I have seen you manage our community over the years. You want to talk about professionality? Rather you would search for dirt on people who write bad reviews of Blockland instead of actually addressing any of the problems that are wrong with your game? I suppose you would, and not really suprisingly... :/http://prntscr.com/2qsz4oAbove is an example of this games professional developer banning a user from his forums for asking when the game will be updated again. This is his professional ban message he leaves them with: "Get ♥♥♥♥ed, I don't owe you anything." ----EDIT:Basically in his other comments he's made in my review (besides the response he left at the bottom of my review) he complains that the things that I say are bad about this game he cannot fix, and that I don't complain about enough; or really any architectural features about the game itself. Honestly the community for this game is so hostile and disfunctional (which is what this review tried to originally describe) and when you put that on top of the fact that the game has not been updated in over a year and is managed very poorly I personally have come to the conclusion that this game is not worth spending your time and money on. That is the point I was trying to make.To talk about the actual gameplay of this game and it's features:The game features a menu where you can select what brick you want and place it ontop of another brick, to build virtually whatever you want. This, along with a minigame creator where you can choose to spawn with weapons and start a deathmatch with other players. Now that there isn't maps anymore I have basically listed all of the features of this game.There has been ONE new / neat thing that was added into the game since the games actual realse by the developer himself . And this was actually really pretty cool (when it came out in 2010) where you can "wrench" bricks to name them, spawn weapons on them and (the new part) "event" them to where you can setup conditional events to make them check for / do certian things (like explode, play a sound, emit an particle, ect.) when you activate them (or when something does). Other than this however (and keep in mind this came out in 2010) there has been nothing new that has been added into the game through an update in the complete history of this games existance. (besides the removal of maps and addition of very poorly optimized shaders - which was hardly an update, if you ask anyone in the community)CAN you build things in this game? Sure you can! I've built castles, houses, all that stuff... But it takes a lot of time to learn how. It's not easy to do. And you're not going to be getting help along the way, as the hostile commuinty doesn't put up with people who have questions, or can't manage things on their own. So if you want to, yes you can - but you're going to have to learn all by yourself and it takes a lot of time before you will get to making anything even half as spectacular as what's shown in the trailer. It's just really a lot more complicated and a lot less convenient than he makes it out to be. After playing the game and building things in it for seven years the way he is advertising it (quite frankly) seems like some sort of trick - atleast to me. The game doesn't have all that stuff in it currently and all of that would be extremely hard to make on your own. There arent't currently servers like that ready where all of that stuff you saw in that trailer will be waiting for you. You CAN make all of those things that are in the trailer, to be fair. However, just no one really does. So to put it clearly, I just don't get the point. Why show a trailer of your game that is not like your game at all / full of things that aren't currently in your game?TO CONCLUDE: The gameplay of this game is NOT bad. It is just a game that hasn't been updated in forever, and is managed very poorly. If you are looking for a game with a future, that has planned updates, friendly technical support or that has a community full of users that you will enjoy to play the game with, DONT buy this game - because well, it has none of these things.

9, 2014
												Why do I have only 0.2 hours played? I did not buy the game through Steam and do not wish to play the game through Steam, so I have run the game for the minimum 10 minutes to be able to post a review.Perhaps the simplest way to describe this game is with one image that describes the lack of development as well as intolerance of criticism by the developer regarding the game's development and outright punishment of his criticizers. In fact, the developer has pre-emptively banned me from Steam's forum for this game.The developer's current response to this review is literally just a quick one-line dismissal as if playing the game for a long time precludes me from talking negatively about it and then he makes a sales pitch.The developer has finally admitted that he has stopped all development[forum.blockland.us] on the game, as if it hadn't been already obvious considering the lack of updates in the past ten months (no longer true), the half-broken Steam version of the game (broken for a year already), and the extremely low quality and quantity of the updates before then. He has resorted to censoring and banning people who criticize the game's development[blocklandcloud.com], so this should be an obvious sign that the game is done for. When or if you buy this abandoned game, consider the fact that this disrespectful, uncaring and greedy "developer" will be getting your money.========Response to developer response (10 August 2014):++++++++++(original developer response)"Hey everyone, right now Blockland is available in the Reboot 6.0 bundle from BundleStars: http://www.bundlestars.com/all-bundles/reboot-bundle-6/6 great Steam games (including Blockland!) for only $2.99!Why not pick it up, play Blockland for 5 years, then leave a negative Steam review?See you back here in 2019!"++++++++++How nice of you to finally respond to one of the most thorough and drama-free reviews once it reached the front page! Oh wait, that's not really a response... it's a sales promotion. A sales promotion is definitely a valid response to everything I've already written here!Believe it or not, it is quite possible to love the art but hate the artist. As a modder myself, I've dealt with years of your ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t when it came to supporting modders and their needs. I had been running a hosting service for quite some time until the day I left, which is one of the biggest reasons I stayed so long. Unfortunately, you decided to take a "♥♥♥♥ it" approach when it came to supporting server hosting services (and modders), so now the game's largest two hosting services are gone and the community is left with almost nothing. You have banned users from your forum for criticizing the game, so once I finally had enough of your ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t, I left the game. Since you have no power here to permanently delete people's opinions, which you do at your own forum (evidence of this is in the very next segment of this review), this was the perfect chance to finally speak my mind without fearing all the possible consequences with which you could punish me. Considering that this review is now the top review, I think it's reasonable to say that people have had enough of your ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t, too.It's not like I suddenly started hating the game. While I was still a part of the community, I felt as if I couldn't speak my mind since you punish everyone who criticizes it. I was able to realize my power to reach out to people once I was free from your reigns, so I exerted that power. This isn't some campaign of revenge: it's years of your ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t finally brought to light.========Update (6 August 2014):The owner of the game (Badspot) has silently banned "Heedicalking" from the game's official forum. Heedicalking is an important person in terms of the servers he hosted and his contributions to the community. Heedicalking often talks about the lack of game development on the forum in the most mature way possible. Development has in fact been lacking recently: in fact, there hasn't been a major update in the last 2 years. Many people were expecting him to be banned for simply criticizing the game's development, and voilà, he has finally been banned. The owner of the game is getting extremely defensive towards anyone who dares talk about the game's lack of development.For reference, here are relevant links pertaining to the post removals:http://blocklandcloud.com/heed/https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/54466069/banned.png========Update (27 June 2014):The owner of the game (Badspot) has banned LewnaJa and me from Blockland's Steam community. He also deleted the entire thread in which he had our responses. The thread (the poster was most likely not the victim) was pointing out how a ban was unfair. The same ban image also happened to be mentioned in an earlier review from February: http://steamcommunity.com//profiles/76561198044732390/recommended/250340/Here is copy of thread: http://blocklandcloud.com/20140626-blockland-steam-removed-thread/The ban reasons for us are the same and the posts cited for our bans were each of our first ones in that thread. This is LewnaJa's ban:http://imgur.com/a/oX0exThe owner has taken similar action towards LewnaJa when he initially posted his negative review and found himself banned from the game's official forum (not Steam's forum provided for the game).Make your own conclusions about why the owner of the game felt so obliged to ban us. Today, the negative reviews have been piling up on the store page to the point where 3 of the 5 shown-to-everyone-by-default reviews were negative and it still remains that way. Fortunately he does not have the power to remove any reviews at all. It must be embarrassing for Badspot to have what is pretty much the front page for his game be covered in negativity.========Original review:I have played this game for more than 5 years (not on Steam) and I am disappointed at how quickly it has declined. Don't be fooled into buying this game just because it looks great. The developers (developer) have abandoned the game. Check out my long elaboration on why I think the game is practically abandoned:http://www.reddit.com/r/BlocklandIsHorrible/comments/267v7h/badspot_is_no_longer_doing_his_fair_share_of_work/The game hasn't had a major update for 2 years and any update for 6 months. The game's most important people have been angry about the developer's ("Badspot") reluctance to maintain the game's development. Check out this satirical comic which illustrates the developer's greed: http://brockrandcomics.tumblr.com/post/92596058472/filipe-7-22-14CLARIFICATION FOR BELOW PARAGRAPH: server hosting issues do not include those who have bought the game in the classical way and duplicated their purchases to their Steam accounts, because they can still run the game the classical way. The below paragraph applies to those who have exclusively bought the game from Steam and not on the Blockland website.If you buy Blockland through Steam, you will have a lot of trouble hosting a server. Although there is technically a way to host a server by modifying the program's arguments, you can't play the game at the same time. Want someone else to circumvent these restrictions by hosting a server for you under your name? Too bad; hosting services cannot be used by people who bought the game through Steam. The developers have neglected Steam users and deprived them of server hosting for over 6 months. I think it's clear that they do not care anymore and are only trying to make a quick buck out of what the game has left.(THIS HAS BEEN AN OUTSTANDING ISSUE FOR OVER A YEAR)Some of you legacy players may find these statistics about the game's decline interesting: http://blocklandcloud.com/

content:
r 9, 2014
												[If you dislike reading seemingly irrelevant information you are free to skip to the bottom of this review. There you will find my recommendation. Thank you!]So this game has been one of my favorite building games of all time. Starting in 2010 along with the majority of what I would say was our community, I bought the original Blockland and was having a great time. Things were getting done, updates being made. There were these classics maps I'll never forget: the Bedroom, the Kitchen, and the Slopes. I enjoyed this game, and I was estimated to be playing it about 10 hours a day or more. (Update: Many people don't believe I played this game as long as I claim. The truth is, Blockland existed before (its release on) Steam. For this reason, Steam has not registered all my hours from when I played it before. I only recently migrated to Steam Blockland from the original Vanilla Blockland. Hope that clears things up!)It took some time but an insightful man by the name of Ephialtes in-game decided to build Blockland a new system. I believe it was around 2011-2012 that this became widely-used. It was called Return to Blockland, and was basically the Steam client for Blockland before Blockland was actually on Steam. It had a 'Workshop' (servers that hosted add-ons you could directly download from), Add-On Manager, Friends client, global IRC chat, chat rooms, easy-to-use settings system for your server, add-on preferences manager, and so much more. It was the true revelation of Blockland's existence. It brought upon a new experience for the Blockland community, and gave it a modern feel.Then this game went on Greenlight.That officially marked the downfall of RTB, which would eventually be shut down because Steam replaced 1/3 of its functionality. There would no longer be a place to manage your add-ons, chat globally with other BL users, find your friends (since they would no longer be on RTB and you didn't know if they had Steam), and last but not least, you could no longer manage your server like you used to.That probably drove me away the most. I stuck around for a bit, hosted a multitude of mildly popular servers as well as a 32/32 player MERP server that consisted of most of my time. After about four months, I kinda lost interest and began the process of leaving the BL community. I left a legacy, but even that would soon be forgotten...So you know that game called Minecraft? I ended up spending almost all of my time on that. I hosted some very popular servers on Minecraft, met some great friends, and was enjoying it. I almost forgot about Blockland completely, but then my friend (who shall remain nameless) decided to get Blockland after I showed him a fun little gamemode on it called Renderman. He got it, and when I saw that he did, I decided to hop back on and play with him... but I didn't do much otherwise.I truly came back about two months ago. I began hosting my MERP server, probably just to feel the nostalgia and see all the empires that had been built on it. A friend of mine by the name of Amir (a full-time player of my server back when it was popular) happened to stop by. We had an awesome reunion, played a bit of MERP (not really. Just remarked on how sucky our builds were), had a lot of fun. I began playing Blockland much more.And then I stopped. Garry's Mod took up my time. I managed a community on there and couldn't depart from them. But that wasn't the only reason.I lost interest.So anyways, if you got to the bottom of this review reading through an incredibly long backstory and wondering why the heck I'd write a story like that, I congratulate you. You have the patience of a... you, but none of this was really a review, was it?So here's my take on the game.If you want to play a game with a large amount of active community supporters/respectful, mature players, don't get this game.If you want to play a game where you build anything and can do anything (with the help of a bit of programming knowledge or the visually-based event system), get this game.If you want to play a game where servers are always full and there is an easy way to liven up your game with user-created add-ons, don't get this game.If you want to play a game where you can host a server of any kind, have some fun with Pirate Ship DM gamemodes, and basically shoot your friends with laser pistols and horse rays (yeah, they turn them into a horse), this game IS FOR YOU.BUT. If you want a game that will keep you interested for years to come, always ready for that next update, always ready for that next big thing... don't get this game. It's unkempt, uncombed, and unfathomably stagnate.But I might be wrong. What if YOU are the next big thing?In my opinion, this game is NOT recommended due to the lack of interesting things that may be found in Blockland. It's a great game, don't get me wrong, but it is running on steam (get it hahahahaaha... haha. ..ha... sorry) and no longer has that spark of a game that has true potential. Maybe Badspot can turn this around one day. And maybe you can be a part of that. Me, on the other hand, have exhausted the game of Blockland. I like the game, but I can no longer play it.Maybe it'll be different for you.

er 16, 2013
												I've probably put over 1500 hours into this before it came to steam.This is one of the best games I have ever played. It's limitlessly open, with a great mature (edit 4 months later: kind of mature, it's a lego game, of course it'll attract kids.) community, and there's just so much to experience, from dogfights, to city RPGs, to gangster shootouts, to go-kart races, to who-knows-what! There's thousands upon thousands of addons (plugins/mods) for the game that are extremely easy to install and the game is still going strong since it's initial build in 2004!Buy this game!Buy it!Buy it now!

content:
5, 2015
												Okay. What i'm about to tell you actually ♥♥♥♥ing happened.I joined an rp server with 15 people. At first i was confused, and went around being a general knob, stealing cars, sitting on people, ect. Somehow i didnt get banned for fail RP. After about an hour of observing these people mingle around, I decided to join in. I sat with them as they put some dude on trial for some reason. Then, everyone got in a treehouse and there was lava and blah blah blah it was interesting, but this isnt the best part. So, after this, everyone started to properly RP. People went to their houses, got their cars, ect. Intrigued by this, I decided to stalk an unsuspecting household and observe everyday life in Blockland. Soon enough, they relised i was watching them, and they dubbed me 'the stalker under the porch' and 'the creepy guy by the window'. I stood around, holding a bunny doll and staring motionlessly in at them. After a while, I managed to get into their house. I stayed low, and snuck around, eating their pizza. Soon enough though, they found me. I retreated into a corner, under their stairs. And they locked me in. Kept me as their pet. I couldnt escape, i couldnt move, i couldnt run. But they fed me and talked to me, and I gave up hope on ever getting out. After a while they got bored and buggered off (they let me out after some persuasion though). After another hour of building my own ♥♥♥♥♥♥ yellow house, i returned to their house, and they welcomed me in this time. They let me use their toilet, watch tv, and partay all night. Some rocket launcher spammers came along but they were soon banned, and the partay carried on. At one point, they embedded me into some concrete like Han Solo in Star Wars. But they let me out eventually. They were cool people, and thats rare to find in a game. And then, some guy came along and told me to follow him. So i followed him, and he led me to his house. He told me to be a baby.  I was confused at first, but then he locked the doors, somehow shrunk me, and made me crawl around, typing baby noises in chat, and chilling in a crib he made. It was ♥♥♥♥ing scary. And i really couldnt escape. After a while he took me to town in his car. I could only crawl around the place, so i happily accepted the transport away from that guys creepy ♥♥♥ house. Now i just needed to lose this guy (without failing rp). The guy crashed the car, and i snuck off, claiming i was a scared and confused baby. Thats where everything went to ♥♥♥♥. I engaged operation 'Grand Theft Baby', stole a car, a gun, and as my baby self, i hit the road. This pedo guy tried looking for me with his jetpack, but i hit the hills and quietly disconected from the game. This was one ♥♥♥♥ing server. I spent 4 hours on 1 ♥♥♥♥ing server having the creepiest yet most fun time of my life. Not to mention the fact that i went insane from the fact that the house i was stalking had some wierd radio playing a song about tacos on repeat. (at one point it glitched out and amplified like 100 times; my ears bled...)This was ONE ♥♥♥♥ing server. There are other great servers, such as the battlefield-esque dogfighting server, or the knife TDM server. This game is absolutley incredible. Not to mention the incredible options for creativity and modding in single player (addons galore!), and the wonderful destruction physics!This game is a must have if you like RP, multiplayer games in general and creative games. Its incredible fun, i played 9 ♥♥♥♥ing hours on my first day of owning it. I love Blockland, and though it may be dying player wise, its still one hell of a time!Its like Lego, Gmod and Roblox had a baby!Oh yeah, and, for whatever ♥♥♥♥ing reason, you can get an achivment called 'gay pirate' for wearing a pink pirate hat. WTF!?10/10 IGNNo seriously, like 8/10 (its buggy, its dying, but as i said, its a hell of a time!)

number of helpful: 264 of 357 people (74%) found this review helpful
content:
er 16, 2013
												The vanilla game may not have a ton to offer, so it all comes down to what the community has to offer (which is a ton). The gameplay makes it a lot like Gmod, except with a more consistant style. Additionally, it's multiplayer architecture makes joining servers with custom content seamless. You'll literally never need to actually install an add-on to play on a server with custom content (with a few exceptions, servers using custom GUI's may want you to install their GUI mods in order to play. This is usually optional anyways.) The gamemode system adds a lot more 'out of the box' fun things to do than the game used to have. But it's still a bit underwhelming and you'll probably only get about a few hours of fun out of it if you refuse to install any add-on gamemodes or other things. Other than a few gamemodes available that are designed to be played in single-player, multiplayer is really where everything is at. There are a number of servers that have been developed for literally years and have a very high quality experience. If you ever really enjoyed Gmod at all, you'll probably find that the most fun servers in Blockland are ones where someone has simply set out a blank slate and a bunch of really neat mods. Shenanigans ensue.It's a game you'll just keep coming back to.Edit: a.

content:
er 4, 2014
												Blockland used to be one of my Favourite games, There were fun map with hidden secrets, The bedroom, The slopes and The kitchen, and you could always get add-ons with  RTB (Return to blockland), an amazing site for finding cool mods. However, Things changed.First of all, Actual maps were removed and only a flat baseplate was left standing. Although there's still structures that you can load up, they're simply no-where near as good as the original maps. This Meant that MP servers were now boring, as most modded gamemodes can't be played. I won't say that the community was ever perfect, it used to be good, but now RTB is abandoned and Blockland servers are basically empty shells of what they used to be. There's also the fact that the blocks that can be used to build are practically LEGO Blocks, which means that even building simple square houses is a tedious process. Overall, Blockland is a true gem lost in time, what used to be a thriving gaming community has become a desolate wasteland and has fallen prey to Money-Hog Developers that can't be bothered to fix their already ruined game.3/10 would not have One of my favourite games ruined again.

number of helpful: 304 of 448 people (68%) found this review helpful38 people found this review funny
content:
2015
												The game is about building anything you can imagine, it's a non-linear sandbox game in which the world is your canvas. Literally a blank canvas.I've played this game since it was in vers. 8. I had the time of my life playing on all the deathmatch and freebuild servers and whatnot.When I discovered addons and mods, I was amazed. People made all sorts of new vehicles, bricks, weapons etc. for the game. I decided I'd download some and try them out.The one addon/mod I really enjoyed was Gamemode_Zombie. It was a L4D-style addon with all the zombie types (boomer, hunter, etc.) There was even a subway map made for it.Now, there was this sort of client within the game called Return to Blockland (RTB). It included a friends list and an addon manager and even a public chat thing where you could talk to anyone that had RTB. It was overall just a neat way to chat with friends and find new addons.But the game has taken a turn for the worse, I am afraid. Not too long ago, RTB was shut down. The friend system was no longer available and the mod downloader/manager was shut down as well. It was much harder to contact friends and see what addons were installed on your game. This made many people upset and the game just sort of died.The game itself, though, had a decent amount of content. There were maps such as Kitchen, The Slopes, and Bedroom that you could explore. Now, these maps weren't made of bricks so that's what made them unique.The V21 update changed this. Maps were replaced by nicer graphics and better shaders,and to make up for the loss of maps we were given an empty slate to build on. The ground and skybox were, or /are/ customizeable with different textures and whatnot.The loss of RTB and the maps has just led to the downfall of this game. The community has turned in to some sort of mix of a Tumblr/♥♥♥♥♥ drama-fest full of feels and oppression where everyone thinks they can flame and argue with each other to solve their problems.I haven't played this game for about 2-3 months because there just isn't anything new or exciting to see and do and, as i stated in the previous paragraph, the community is just downright bad. The servers are low-quality with 99.9% of them being horrid Five Nights at Freddy's RPs and that last .1% being an actual good server with decent admins and choice of addons. (which honestly is hard to find, you should be happy if you actually manage to find or make one.)I can't exactly recommend this game. Once it gets better (which it clearly never will), then maybe I'll change my review.maybe.I give this game a 3/10.TL;DR-------The game was good up until v21.-Maps were awesome and now we just have a blank slate.-There was a good community with a good amount of content.-RTB closed down and everything went bad, especially the community.-FNAF fanboys.-tumblr party-RIP, Blockland.-3/10sorry for the novel of a review.

number of helpful: 828 of 1,278 people (65%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
er 16, 2013
												-PLEASE READ ALL COMMENTS BELOW-August 8th: Badspot snaps and admits the development is screwed:http://forum.blockland.us/index.php?topic=264261.msg7762181#msg7762181Edit of August 8th: Removed some old data to make room for new dataPlease visit http://www.reddit.com/r/BlocklandIsHorrible after reading this review."http://forum.blockland.us/index.php?&topic=256488.msg7466927#msg7466927Check out how the guy who made this game describes in detail why he encourages ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ behavior." - AmadiohaEdit of March 22nd: Someone has made a claim that Badspot has attempted to hire them to gather my personal information -- like home address, work place if applicable, and other things. He also claims that he would have gotten this information through sending me viruses. I worry about the reasoning behind his desire for my personal information.Given that this kind of activity is illegal, I have sent Badspot an email regarding this situation and am currently awaiting his response and see whether or not he denies the accusations. Since the "hacker" gave me the information, I have nothing against him and don't plan to take any action against him. I am posting this update because he is ignoring my emails, making him even more suspicious.Edit of March 11th, in response to the developer's desperate attempt at defending himself after making himself look like a clown:Before judging me as a person, please read how the users of Blockland reacted to a disliked user's house being burned down and his cat being killed: http://forum.blockland.us/index.php?topic=181239.0Please ignore the developer's response for now. If you want to know why he is resorting to such low tactics to defend himself, I insist that you read all of the comments below on all pages. I will address the developer's response directly from the comments in order to save space on this review and to prevent people from reading my life story when the review is about Blockland.Edit of March 6th, in response to the developer editing his response in effort to work around his original comment's deletion which was intended to harass me:Eric Hartman (Badspot), has a history of being childish in the way he handles things. He has let children upset him to the point of exposing their personal information and families' information over the internet in an effort to have his community harass them in his defense.While there is only one case that I know of where this has occurred, it is unacceptable and is a violation of that person's privacy rights. Badspot revealed the payment names and email addresses of this user which, I'm pretty sure, is against the law.Here is the "Drama Dossier" on a user who has made the mistake of upsetting Badspot: http://badspot.us/Zac-Conover.htmlALL of his communication data which was collected by Badspot through SECURE PAYMENTS and was trusted to him, a man selling his product. How can you explain that? You give a man selling a legitimate product your money and he exposes the information you used on his website because you angered him. Does that sound professional to you? I think not.The question you should be asking yourselves is: Do you want to end up like this guy? If you bother Badspot enough, he'll do the same to you. I have hardly done anything worth being called out for because this man has ignored my existence until the very moment I called him out on the one place he still has a chance to milk money from users with a game he doesn't even take care of.-Edit of February 25th, removed for updated data----- Original Review ----I'll be the first to write a somewhat negative review about this game:First: I started playing this game around 2006-07, prior to Retail Blockland's (the current game) release. This game is almost entirely community-based. This game is what you want to make it, which means the community needs responsible, creative users to help form a fun game for everyone.This has been a problem since the recent removal of maps, which were an easy way to play the game without putting too much effort into it. Currently, the game has a lack of creative players which have caused many, many players to quit the game due to the lack of content from the developer (which he removed maps with a promise of more content, which never came, even a year later), and the lack of decent servers to play on.However, Blockland has always had the problem of a small community which has made decent servers scarce. The lack of maps has left mapmakers without their ability to contribute to Blockland, causing them to leave along with many other players who enjoyed playing on maps rather than the default (and now, the only) map, "Slate".I'm not going to lie. I, and many others have felt that the game has been dead (or dying) for a long time now. Even when maps were still here, the game was dying slowly, but surely -- the removal of the maps just kickstarted it because nobody knew how to cope with the lack of creative builders to replace the position that maps once held.Steam, for some of us, is believed to be the last resort for Blockland's future. It's up to you, the newest purchaser who is reading this review, to help reform the community into something better, more active, and more stable.Another problem is that since the maps were removed, many players with low-spec computers were forced to quit due to being unable to process the amount of bricks it would take to create a "map".So, if you've got a low-spec PC, I would not recommend this game to you until you get a computer with a decent processor and graphics card. Otherwise, you'll be playing with a constant lag that will drive you to hate the game.The shaders are poorly optimized. (And I mean, they are *extremely* poorly optimized.) So the majority of the Blockland community don't even play with the shaders that we sacrificed our maps for because they can't even run them. Not even high-spec computers can run the shaders with a large amount of bricks unless you've got a ridiculously powerful computer. I've got a quad-core i5 processor and an AMD 7870 Graphics card, 2GB video memory, and I can run Battlefield 3 on max settings with over 60FPS, whereas I have trouble running shaders on max in Blockland and end up only getting around 28-30FPS with builds that are around 50k bricks or more.The gameplay is good as long as you play on a decent server, it depends on your tastes.I'm also going to warn anyone who buys this game: Prepare to be flamed, trolled, or annoyed by the community at some point. The game has one of the most merciless, rude, arrogant communities I have ever been a part of. However, that's not the majority of the community. A lot of the community is very nice and like to take part with each other in building projects or film-making and such. But if you ask me, the community needs an increase in better players.To conclude, we have a lack of a decent, creative playerbase right now and we need more players with more creativity and will to step forward and create something awesome out of this game. Everything in the trailer IS possible, but most of it has never happened and will never happen unless we have more creative players. The trailer was highly exaggerated and the game is far more boring than that. But like I said, everything in the trailer is possible, but it hasn't happened -- yet.So, if you're willing to be a good player and you want to help revive an almost-dead game and form it into a better game for everyone's enjoyment, buy the game. If you don't want to work with the community, hate playing games that take time and effort to make something good out of it, or just generally dislike overhyped games, don't buy it. Even though the game is overexaggerated, it doesn't mean we can't work together to make it that awesome.It's up to you.

content:
er 23, 2016
												I got into Blockland back in 2005 when I was just 11 years old, and back then it was a free game that looked just like Legos, and ever since then, I've seen people and friends come and go, rivalries with other games that were only similar in the concept of 'sandbox game where you can build and destroy anything'.As someone who had practically no social interaction prior, this game and it's community actually helped me grow and mature as a person, I've met so many cool, intelligent, talented and funny people over the years and even became friends with some of them, and it got me in to basic C++ scripting, 3D modeling, audio editing, and even a bit of video making. It is at this point that I feel like I owe my life to this game. Even to this day, I find myself coming back to this game every now and then to build something, to create a new mod, try out someone else's mod, or to just goof about on servers.This game, for me, and several others, is like the 'Hotel California' of video games, you may leave, you may stop playing for a while, but you always come back, for one reason or another. Even those who don't like this game or it's community and get banned for their actions keep spending more of their money just to come back, it's like a drug that you just can't quit!For the 11 years I've been at this game, I've been very active on the message boards, and it's been such an interesting, funny, and unique community over the years, and I've been able to watch it grow and change as time went on, like, I've never been so invested in a community as I am with Blockland's.I do hope that Blockland becomes as popular as games like Roblox, some may disagree with me on this, that they prefer this smaller and more controlled crowd of people, but Blockland really does deserves a bigger audience, it actually is a fun and amazing game. It may be slow and tedious to build something big and amazing, but that's how building is with every sandbox game, "Rome wasn't built in a day.", and if building isn't your thing, there's just a big variety of gamemodes and servers out there that are PvP death-matches, role playing servers, a boss battle server, knife fights in the sky with grappling hooks, dog fights, single-lap races, multi-lap races-- there's just so many to choose from, you're bound to find something you like!The biggest problem with the game is 'time', what time of the day you get on matters, what time-zone you live in compared to other people matters, what day of the week it is matters, time is a big factor in finding busy and/or good quality servers.While I recommend this game, I also commend checking out the message boards, there you can chillax and talk amongst others that play the game, get help with the game, post pictures of things you built or did, download add-ons or other sorts of mods that people make, or just talk about whatever else, about other video games, or about drawings or other sorts of creative things you or other people do!

content:
er 3, 2014
												I played this game back when it wasn't on Steam, I was one of those annoying five-years-olds who destroyed other people's stuff. I had a one month membership on this game, and I played it non-stop (most likely over 200 hours total) for the short time I had it. After I ran out of the membership, I went to Roblox (bad idea, big war going on between Blockland and Roblox at that time). After I quit Roblox, I went to Minecraft. Then I (semi)quit Minecraft and went to Steam. After about two years on Steam, I found this game. I had wonderful flashbacks of how me and my cousin would destroy everything, and build it again, then destroy it, again and again and again. My previously mentioned cousin actually bought this game for me (props to you, my friend!) on steam and we played. Although a lot changed, almost to the point where I couldn't recognize it, I still had fun. The new maps were fun, the old maps were still fun, and the whole game had been transformed into a world of small communities and close friends. This is one of my favorite games right now, and I recommend it for my own story, but you should buy this game so you can make your own story, and in a few years, when you are a pro at Blockland, look back at this review and make your own. I know that sounds really cheesy, but seriously, we need to have fun with our games and tell the amazing times and adventures that we have in those games to show people why they should create their own. So, buy this game, right now. Make your own story. Make your own review. Do what I have done, tell others to do so. This is the perfect game for it, so much to do, so much to see. So, what are you waiting for, do it!

ry 1, 2015
												This game is a good game IF: You put in the time to learn it.  I have put about 5 months into this game outside of steam, and I still love it.  I feel like I can get more out of it the more I play it.I am going to address most of the things the negative reviews are saying about this game. 1.  Minecraft is betterIn this game it is hard to build things that look good, but you can make things in much greater detail than in minecraft.  The building in this game is superior to minecraft's building.  You can build things with dozens of different bricks (not including brick mods) unlike minecraft that just has a standard block with different textures and a few other detail blocks like fences.  Minecraft has a terrible combat system that makes it awful for mini games.  This game has amazing combat elements.  You can do anything in this game in minecraft, but not nearly as well or easily.  Minecraft combat and minigames feel cheap and not very well put together.  I personally hate minecraft, but that does not make it a bad game.     It is a good survival sandbox game, but it ends there.  Anything above that can be done better in so many other games.2.  The developer is awfulWho cares, you are buying the game not the developer.  If you are not on the forums and arn't stealing anyones keys or doing something that would get you banned from any other multiplayer game on steam, you will be fine.  I have never had a problem with the developer at any time.3.  The community is awfulI really have not noticed this outside of the forums, and even so, it is mostly the drama section of the forums that is awful.  It depends on the server you go on of course, but the whole community is not awful.  The bad community in this game consists of the ones that keep complaining about how terrible the developer and community is.  I don't see them doing anything to make it better, they just tick off the developer with their constant complaining which I find makes me angry as well.  I don't even deal with a hundreth as much as the developer does, so excuse him for for being cranky sometimes.If you look for terrible people in a community you will find terrible people in a community.  If you look for awesome people in a community you will find awesome people in a community.4.  Not enough content/game is dyingNot true.  Since this game has been on steam only over a year at the time of this review, the community has more than trippled.  Dying? ok sure.  More people means more mods and servers.  Mods are so easy to install in this game, and it is the only game that I do not find it to be a hassel to do so.  People have modded the game so heavily that it does not even feel like the same game anymore.  This game is fairly dependant on mods, but it has some VERY good mods.5.  Terrain/interriors replaced with shaders and it ruined the gameTerrain and interriors were not all that great.  Like really they were ok for a few servers, but I only used the flat maps and built my own terrain.  They simply were not easy to build on in many cases which happens to be one of the main points of the game.  The shadows and shaders look amazing and are also moddable.  Even if you cannot run them, it does not take away from the game.  There is an environment editing GUI that allows you to edit the lighting, weather, fog, ground texture/color, water level, and other things.  One of the most used maps before the removal of terrain was adjustable plate which was the same thing as the environment edit GUI but not as good.And finally...This game is great if you put the time in to learn it and have friends to play with.  Most of the time I have put into this game I have played without friends, so they are not required to have fun.  There are times when there are not many interesting servers to join, but even then you can just host your own.  Don't listen to those complaining about the community and the dev.  If you like building and or a casual FPS I would highly recommend this game.  There have been times when I did not build for months playing this game, and I just enjoyed the fighting/shooter servers.

Played since 2007, even before the Steam Greenlight migration happened. Basically, I grew up with this game. I met some good friends in the community. It was good. I'm not sure up until now since the new visual features were added, but still a good game in its core. I've spent a ♥♥♥♥♥on of hours on this game ever since. Now, I think I've grown up from this game, but I think new people can appreciate it as well.RTB (Return to Blockland) was game's greatest community mod API ever. Unfortunately, it was shut down by its creator Ephialtes, due to a majority of its functionality was overrun by Steam's community tools. It's sad, because a majority of good, curated add-ons were on its database. I just hope Badspot (the developer) finds a way to introduce the Steam Workshop to Blockland in order to compensate this.The downside to add-ons recently is that all add-ons are not curated anymore, just scanned for malicious or too-crappy code/content. Nonetheless, some high quality add-ons still exist in the community forums.Disclaimer though,A high percentage of the community is difficult to manage with (considering most are kids at the moment). This can be avoided if you have a lot of patience in communicating with children.Again, due to the most of the community being children, banning was a common act of the developer. There were as well, older people who are apparently trolls who love to spark the fire in the community. Some are it for fun, while some are it for revenge. This is the reason why some people are angry at the developer for cleansing the community of many people.Only a fraction are those excellent to play with and communicate with. Occasionally, you will find a fraction of this community on some servers.

number of helpful: 109 of 180 people (61%) found this review helpful8 people found this review funny
content:
r 27, 2014
												     Before we even get started, some people might say "Oh, this looks like a Minecraft copy." but that is incorrect, as it was around way before Minecraft was even thought up of. It's not like Roblox either (Ah the famous Blockland vs Roblox wars...) because of the more solid platform and no subscription. So what is this then? Good question. I think Badspot, the creator of the game, can sum it up quite nicely:"Blockland is an online multiplayer game where you build things with bricks.It's like playing with legos on the internet."     In my mind, Blockland is one of the best construction/building sandbox games ever made. It is one of my personal favorites that I've played since 2007. I probably have over 600 hours ingame. (Not including Steam) You can do just about anything in this game, from FPS Team Deathmatches to racing to <variable>. Blockland is quite fun by itself, but the real reason you get it is for the high modability. Thousands of community creations keep the game interesting, and populated. Vehicles, weapons, gamemodes, scripts, events, this game has it all for customization. While singleplayer lets you experiment and test, multiplayer is where most people will choose to spend their time. There is always a server up for a specific type of play. (And they usually have good admins)     There is one part where Blockland has an issue...The community is not amazing. (Most of the modders are amazing though) If you go on the official forums you will most likely see tons of hate/spam/garbage/negativity. The moderators do a good job of clearing out the useless and hurtful stuff, but I feel as if its always been like this. If you are like me, you really don't let it get to you; but I can see how it might be unacceptable to others.     Other than this (really) small issue, I completely and fully recommend Blockland to anybody that is even slightly interested in sandbox games or being creative.10/10

												PROS:-Graphics: Graphics are quite nice. The bricks are very accurate to real life. Plus there are shaders.-Eventing: You can program your bricks to appear/disappear, shoot a rocket, or you could build an entire computer!-Bots: Comes with fully programmable bots. You can make them kill you, or fight for you.CONS:-Addons: You needs loads of addons to do anything really cool, or to get people to join your server.-RTB: Return to Blockland was a great addon system with advanced features and IRC, and it no longer exists.-Eventing: The event interface is nice for beginners, but once you start making more complex things, it becomes quite cumbersome.-Lack of updates: The developer is inactive most of the time. Don't expect anything more to come out of this.-Vehicle physics: Vehicles glitch through walls/floor, especially flying ones.-Controls: Sometimes they are quite hard for beginners to learn, mostly building. If you don't have a number pad, this can become quite difficult.Yep, that's my take on the game. It really has the potential; but it just wasn't executed right.

content:
er 26, 2014
												Ok, before you start dissing me on this, let me just say a few things:1. Just because RTB's service was shutdown, it does NOT mean the game is ruined. You can still get addons off of mirrors, and some addons even have a new IRC/addons manager. You can even still use the old RTB client for managing your addons as well, just not downloading them.2. Badspot is not saying the community is the problem. He is saying that it is a specific age group, and he can not control all of them. They host their own servers, with their own rules. Don't get mad if one of them happens to ban you for acting annoying to them or others, or you don't read their rules.3. When you think of the community, you're probably thinking of the forums. Let me just say, that you're probably browsing the Off-Topic section and just saying that's not normal. Please note, you are looking in the OFF-TOPIC section. Most Blockland related things are in the Blockland, Files, and Modification Help sections.Alright, now to the review.This game is a load of fun, mainly because you can honestly do whatever you want. You can build a house, make a sprite from a game in blocks, have a deathmatch with some friends, it's almost ALL customizable.There's also addons you can download to add new blocks, events, weapons, tools, and other things to the game. A example of a new way to play is Unlimited Mining, which is exactly what it says on the tin: Mining that can stretch forever. It may seem boring, but it's not just the same ores. The deeper you dig, the closer you get to the Core, which has more valuable and radiated ores. and then, there's the secret area above grounds, that's very difficult to find...The multiplayer's fun as well, you just need to be careful on what servers you go on, and read their rules carefully. Some people don't seem to get this, and end up joining random servers, get banned, and get all flustered wondering what they did wrong. People have their own rules, and others might not want you on your server.And finally, there's the downtime. Normally, this isn't our fault. It's a problem with a few other people, like BDX, or Man of Reason, DDoSing the server when they feel like it, causing the master server and forums to go down. The master server is how you are able to see the server list. If that's down, you probably won't be able to join any servers.Even though this game may seem off due to bad reviews, this game is what helped me finally play with others and have some fun. It was fun in 2008, and it's fun now. Try buying it while it's on sale, when it ever does, so you can spend less to try it. Even better, you can download the demo here: http://blockland.us/Download.htmlYou'll have to buy the game in order to play past the block limit, but trust me, it's much better when you're not limited.

content:
, 2015
												I love this game.No, let me rephrase that.I loveD this game.This game used to be great. There were many custom maps to explore, and lots of community gamemodes to play. There was always a lot of people to play with and the community was generally awesome. Did you notice any thing about those last sentences? One; Everything I listed was community-made. The developer's actual content is not very interesting to play with for more than a few hours. Two; It was past tense. Maps were actually REMOVED from the game for no good reason and a good portion of the community left due to that. And then RTB stopped. RTB, or Return to Blockland, was a mod for Blockland which worked as a mod manager and also friends list. RTB was awesome and was the only thing anyone used to keep track of friends and get mods. And then, one day, RTB was gone. The servers were down and you couldn't download it anymore. That caused a large portion of to leave the game and now we're left with the remains of a once amazing game, barely managing to keep enough players.You could buy this game as it is. I wouldn't blame you. This game is still good, if only for a day or two. But if you do buy this don't get it on steam, and get this (free) version to go along with it: https://github.com/portify/blockland-20DISCLAIMER: You cannot use this without owning Blockland, and even if you could, I would not endorse doing so without a purchase. If you run a server on the main master server of Blockland using this version, your account may be terminated. You cannot use this with the steam version of Blockland because steam users do not have keys.

It's basically a group of users who argue a lot and spend more time on the forums than playing the actual game. Development is also deteriorating. Version 21, which was released in August 2012, was the last major update to the game. It was supposed to make it easier to add more features in the future, but a major update has not been released yet. Blockland also uses a 15-year-old game engine and this causes a lot of problems for add-on makers, such as glitchy vehicle physics and limitations on projectile speed.In conclusion: great gameplay and originality, but horrible community and slow development.EDIT: Yesterday, Heedicalking, a notable member of the Blockland community peacefully protested against the lack of the new features (which were promised exactly 2 years ago). Badspot, the owner of the game, deleted his posts and banned him on three accounts: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/54466069/banned.png

number of helpful: 13 of 17 people (76%) found this review helpful
content:
8, 2014
												Although I do still find the game entertaining from time to time, I would not recommend it now for other users. Here are the reasons why:The in-game servers and content don't have the same variety or atmosphere as they had when I first bought the game 3 or 4 years ago. Although that could just be nostalgia talking, that is, of course, something that drastically affects my relationship and experience with the game.The engine isn't at all the best (After all, it's more than a decade old. To be more frank, the game engine is virtually ancient.), which puts some signifcant limitations on modders, despite the admittedly incredulous amount of flexibility and ease of the add-on system.Although there are some good-looking shaders, they are not well-optimised, and were put into the game hastily at the cost of the mapping system that the game had, at the dismay of many players.The creator of the game, Badspot, has shown little to no interest in actively participating in enriching Blockland's community and playability, and although he does argue that the players are very much capable of expanding the enjoyment of the game, the players alone are not as impactful as an update from the creator of the game that would allow more capacity to do what you want with the game, regardless of the level of quality and initiative of the said community at hand.Although that's all I could think of right now, I will add more of my gripes and arguments about this game in later edits, and maybe even possibly completely rewrite this review. Like I said earlier, it's not as fun and filled with variety in user-generated content as it was before, which could very well say something about the community. I have been playing far before the game even was greenlighted on Steam, and have witnessed the transformation of this game overtime. If the developer of the game or other members of the community would like to talk to me about this review, or perhaps get feedback from me on my opinion on how to improve the game, you are more than welcome to. Thanks for reading.

												It's a fun time sink of a game, unfortunatly what drove me orignally to the game was it's great community. The final straw was the v21 update; all yall  young whipper snappers don't know the pain from the death of the terrain. It was truly tragic for most players, we traded off brilliant 3d maps with hills and terrains for what? shaders that probably still totally suck, brick collisions with both vehicals and entities are garbage, kiling off some of the more popular servers. It's been a while since of played but I seriously doubt anything has changed.If you do just like legos and building things, this is the game for you.----EDIT----Since some ♥♥♥ hat couldnt interpret that I played the game before steam, given my .7 hours play time and the fact that I said I played while there was terrain, while also complimenting(?) my grammar, I just need to point out that I have put thousands of hours into this game, I started playing around june of 2011. dunno if ID's are still a thing, but look up 30927. the name SHOULD be TestZombie, unless one of my dumb-as-nails siblings changed it when i forgot to log off steam once.----EDIT----Thinking about what this game used to be litterally gives me depression. It's like the original TEEN TITANS series compared to Teen Titans Go; except instead of TTG its actually just a 15 minute video of a dog Taking a ♥♥♥♥ then being hit by a train.OH and what I edited to say was - apparently mods don't even exist for the game now that it has been green lit to steam, this was practiaclly Lego Gary's Mod except 100x better than the 2 of them combined, so the terrain death update shortly followed by Steam destroyed the very small glimmer of hope that could possibly have still existed for this game. number of helpful: 10 of 12 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
y 3
												TL;DR, the community is dead but the game would be really ♥♥♥♥ing good if people got back on itI'll be honest, back when I got this game a few years before it got greenlit the community was really thriving in comparison to how it's like today. A part of me even thinks that the greenlight was only done to try and garner new players, which obviously didn't work out much at all.Blockland isn't like Minecraft or Roblox, and don't let anyone tell you otherwise. Blockland is a lego-style sandbox that (in my eyes) is a nice blend between the game mechanics that Minecraft and Roblox have to offer. You don't need to be an expert in some external first-party program to build great games, (Like Roblox) and you don't need to build massive contraptions to give your basic blocky world some life and functionality. (Like Minecraft) You are already given all the base tools you need to build things like RPGs, deathmatch arenas, cities, race tracks, whatever you want.The community is less than to be desired, I'll be the first to admit. But it's not like any game community is perfect, you'll always have trolls and kids trying to mess with you or other players, but that's in the spirit of the freedom that these kinds of games will bring. With the community pretty much washed out at this point, I'd say some sort of revival, a "renaissance" if you will, would make it blossom into the large and creative community we saw back in it's golden days.If you're new to the game, I recommend getting it during a steam sale in case you aren't satisfied. If you happen to know what Blockland was like but haven't gotten it yet, €10 is a small price to pay in my opinion.Gameplay - 9/10- Minigames - 8/10- Building - 10/10- Multiplayer - 9/10Community - 5.5/10- Old: 8/10- Current: 3/10

content:
er 16, 2013
												I've grown up with Blockland for 5 years, and it has taught me a lot of things along it's pretty bumpy road. It's gotten me entirely into what I can call a 'lust for technology', because otherwise, I wouldn't be as interested in technology as a whole if it weren't for Blockland. Another thing is that, most everything I have learned or started to develop a skill about is also rounded about on Blockland, specificly, my sound designing 'expertise'. As a side note, I'm actually investing in sound recording equipment this christmas.Blockland is not only largely based upon it's users to make content, much like Roblox or maybe even Minecraft, but it does a good job of making it easy to do so. I'm just barely starting off with being a content creator for the game yet I've already got the ropes, and I already create some good stuff for the game.The community isn't as great as most lego games, but it's in a way, a 'mature' community. The community is incredibly assholish, especially on the forums, but in a way where most of the people won't go overboard over small things, and if you aren't a total idiot people won't try to kill you.Lastly, I just wanna say, Blockland has many memories planting itself into my mind that I probably will never forget. The game holds so much promise for the future, and has always delivered in the past. People have doubted it before, even the community itself, but the game always keeps moving forward. Roblox, to compare, still retains it's immature community, it's pretty laggy systems, and it's really money-sucking notoriety for builders club.

number of helpful: 14 of 20 people (70%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
, 2014
												I think this game has gone downhill for a while. I remember when I first played it in 2010 and it was pretty decent I guess. There was a good stream of updates now and then and the game was actually enjoyable. But now I have no idea where it's gone to. The community of the game really drags it down for me, and since this game is almost 90% based on multiplayer, it might affect you too. The community is not forgiving at all so if you do something wrong/bad you will still be bashed for it years later. The community loves to accuse you of doing things that you never did, such as conducting a denial of service attack. Nowadays, the creator barely pushes out updates and there hasn't been any meaningful updates for what seems to be an eternity. The creator of the game also is censoring people's negative reviews and banning them from discussions for peacefully expressing their opinions both on Steam and the Blockland Forums (by the way, if you're going to play the game, never join the Blockland Forums for sure. I can't tell you how screwed up that place is). The game is, from time to time, enjoyable when you find a good server that is fun and has no hostile/bashing people on it. But otherwise I think this game has really gotten worse since my first purchase of it in 2010. You choose if you want the game and are willing to completely ignore the community. I don't suggest you play it if you want to play on multiplayer a lot. The community is small and everybody can quickly know who you are and attack you for the rest of your stay if you screw up a few times.Also there's the "screw-up recurrence" game. You screw up and you know what you did was dumb. But the community keeps attacking you so you intentionally fight back and then at that point you're marked as a "problem user" and immediately banned from all game discussions. So if you like to express your opinions without censorship regarding the game, this is not the place to do it.Yeah my review will probably be censored since i'm marked as a "problem" user but what can I say? You choose if you can ignore a hostile/corrupted/censoring community and creator where people actually think you can mark an "opinion" as wrong. If you can, sure, play the game all you want and maybe you'll enjoy it. If you don't think you can, you might not want to try this game. I think this game is pretty good but the community/creator is bad. That's just my personal opinion, you can try the game and see if you like it. I mean it has events, vehicles, add-ons, weapons and a bunch of cool stuff but the community / creator drag it down for me so you can choose if it matters to you.*UPDATE 8/7/2014*The creator also has censored posts / banned people from the official game forum. The posts were constructive criticism (not intended to insult or flame in any way) which expressed disappointment due to the lack of meaningful updates and unmet promises of the developers. The community member who has most recently been affected by this is Heedicalking, a well known community member who is known for making good servers (frequently team deathmatch servers).He expressed his disappointment in the lack of development in a constructive and respectful way but he was banned twice and his posts were censored (deleted).Here is a backup of the censored posts (they are written by Whitebeard and SHU-YA)http://blocklandcloud.com/20140807-heedicalking-deleted-posts/ http://blocklandcloud.com/20140807-heedicalking-deleted-posts2/

												The game was good for its time but there are better things available now. I wouldn't reccomend picking up Blockland as the developer has essentially stopped working on the product.Minecraft is a much more adventure-based sandbox game with a lively modding community and is suitable for younger players (including children), but doesn't lose its appeal on adults.Space Engineers is (as of writing) an early access game for building your own space craft. Its building system feels like Blockland, but it's backed by a very cool physics engine. More suitable for older players and adults, especially if you're interested in realism and engineering based sandbox games.Blockland was a game I played for quite some time, but it hasn't aged well and has been usurped by newer and better things.
