												The community is what you make it, development has been in a slump recently but this game is complete and has provided a lot of replayability and room for creativity for me and a lot of the friends I made on this game (note I have few hours on steam version but likely a few hundred before I got it on Steam). Many of the negative reviews are people complaining about the developer not consistently putting out free updates consistently even for years after release, despite a strong modding community, and these people also tend to be problem users that stir up drama with developers are other players on the forum. This game IS definitely worth it, and I dare someone to tell me why its not. There is some cruddy servers but there is also the occasionally great server, just like most sandbox multiplayer games. If you're remotely interested in a lego based sandbox building game, get this game.

												This is a really good sandbox game! It's flexible (not as flexible as ROBLOX, though), and it's quite easy to set up certain game-modes. There's a large add-on archive which has lots of things that'll appeal to you. You can create your own add-on with some scripting knowledge (lua, I believe), and a graphics software such as Blender. It can range from new zombie types to guns, to vehicles, to items like Night Vision goggles!There's only one real issue that I may have noticed. The developer can be quite rude at times (sources are from the reviews + screenshots), and that the game really isn't updated often anymore. You don't really need updates to enjoy the game, though! Add-ons serve a large purpose.

content:
y 12, 2014
												Five years of Blockland (3 years of activity):I've been playing Blockland since some of earlier days, starting in v10.  Over the whole course of that time, I've been a fairly active user.  From the time I joined in 2008 until April 2009, I was learning the ropes, how to behave, proper etiquette, etc.  In April, Blockland was un-installed when I was grounded, and I slipped away from it.  In early 2012, after several half-hearted attempts to get it back, I got it working again.  I've made a fool of myself on many occasions, but I've contributed in many ways too, mostly to in-game servers.  Blockland is definitely one of the best games I have ever played/owned in my life.Note to new Steam users: I've noticed that a lot of people have probably discriminated against you for being new.  Please don't be discouraged by this.  The majority of our community is not like that, and is more than willing to help you with anything you might need.  One of the best ways to cut the discrimination is to change your name.  You start with a default name where (*) are the ID numbers (Blockhead*****).  At the bottom of the title screen, hit the button saying 'Name' and enter any name of your choosing (assuming that it is available).- XR_7 (50690)

content:
ber 14, 2015
												I've spent hours upon hours building everything from boats to castles to spaceships, and playing games with other people online, most likely making Blockland my second-most-played game of all time. This was a long, long time before the game appeared on Steam, however, so you'll just have to take my word for it. I have yet to find another sandbox building game that gives you the level of freedom that Blockland does, with an endless supply of user-created add-ons in the form of blocks, game-modes, and more. LEGO sets were one of my favorite toys as a child, so being able to not only have endless bricks to build with but also the ability to explore my creations up-close as a small minifigure and interact with them was a dream come true.While some people will use their imagination to bring physical form to whatever they can think up, my forte was always recreating things from other media. Not the most creative thing in the world, but it was the most enjoyable for me. At various points I worked on reconstructing playable versions of Team Fortress 2's ctf_2fort, Pokemon's Kanto region, and the entirety of Portal, as well as a large-scale model of Halo's Rocket Launcher. My only regret is that I'm not very good at finishing what I've started, as the Rocket Launcher was the only thing that ever reached total completion.Most people tend to complain about the userbase, but it's only as bad as any other place composed mostly of people in grade-school who haven't been a part of an online community before. Certain problematic users will insist this game is bad, but only because they've been punished for misbehaving time after time after time. Overall, it just takes time to adjust.

												I first discovered Blockland in 2009, and I fell in love with it. Combining my hours on and off of Steam I have accumulated some 2.4 thousand hours of gameplay. The building system is complex as hell, and if you're not good with Legos then this really isn't for you. The game's fanbase has largely died out due to the death of RTB and maps (just go on the Blockland forums and look at old gallery topics or soemthing). Most of the servers that other people have started are cancer.I think my point is that if you can have fun on your own, making your own games, building your own maps, hosting your own original servers, this is the game for you. If you've come because you want to ♥♥♥♥ around in prebaked maps and have laughs, search elsewhere.

content:
y 10, 2014
												Blockland may look like a Minecraft or Roblox clone at first glance to some people,but it really isn't and it in itself is much more than that. So BL is a building game first made in 2004 in the V0002 state, the retail version was then released in 2007 with the latest version being V21. Have you've ever played with LEGO's as a kid or built something with them? Did you ever have fun with them? If yes, then Blockland is the game for you. The game allows you to build with a virtually unlimted amount of bricks (There's a 256,000 brick limt,but you can set your own limt on your own server). It also even features an in-game eventing system that allows you to do cool stuff with your bricks like make a door that open and closes or a light switch. The modding community is also pretty good with a good number of brick packs, vehicles, colorsets, music, and etc. The community itself isn't the best, but there really isn't a perfect community out there anyway. You may meet some bad players here and there,but if you stay away from the bad side of the community you'll be fine. The graphics are very blocky and legolike giving a very nice look especially for a old 2003 engine.There are shaders in the game,but they look very jaggy and bad and they're also very poorly optimized at it too.If you want to there are modifications that can help you make the shadows look smoother,but you'll need a great PC to get it done. I would really recomend this game to anybody if you like building games and don't worry you'll really get your money's worth, I've spent at least about 400hrs (With my old blid and steam blid combined) on the game and haven't stopped yet.Note: When you first get the game I would highly recommend getting RTB.

This game would be my all time, top 5 favorite games of all time because this game is not a competetive game if you do not want it to be. You choose whatever you want to do, whenever you want, experiencing it with friends online or just play on your own time to yourself. You can add many interesting toold, features, decals, and more to spice up your games' features. You can add these weapons and tools made by your fellow community from the forums or ingame with the rtb client. Anyways, this game would strongly be recommended by me as this game makes me feel like I am not only building with legos, but creating the creations I have dreamt of since I was young.

content:
, 2014
												EDIT 2: ♥♥♥♥ my reviews just look at my hoursOriginal:It may just look like a game where you just place bricks. Its alot more than that.This game opens alot of opportunites. You go on, click the join game button and see a list of at least 20 servers. Theres always plently of servers open. Prision Escape, Fort Wars, FreeBuild, CTF, Diesease, Murder Mystrey, Bot Wars, Role-play severs, Speedkart and Deathrace are all good examples. Some are modded, some arent. Another good part of the game is the mods are automatically downloaded.Edited in for popular demand: Minigames and eventing are amazing. Start up a mini game and make it the way you want. Turn the mini game to a capture the flag ot even a City RPG.Eventing is even better. Event a brick so when you click on it, it plays a song or even tells you something. Make hidden rooms with disappering bricks, Make your bots look like you, Make traps so people fly into the air and so much more that i cant remember.Sadly, on mac, It is a bit glitchy. You cant see any faces, when you start up the game it asks you to setup your settings and your player always resets.Singleplayer is mostly good for nothing, unless you have some fun mods or you just want to mess around with bots or something.It is still the funnest game ive ever played in history of games ive played. EDIT: e.g. ive played 200 hours of it. (and none of my other games have come close to that.)Mods are hard to get, there are some websites that have archives of the epic website, RTB. (that is closed) In all its such a fun game, but there are a few sad reasons of not to get it. I'd reccomend it to people that like: sandbox, building, fps, loling, role-playing, zombies and tf2 like games!!

												yeah its funEDIT:I've played this game for a while, and I've decided to revisit it after not playing it for a while, and it made me realize how awesome it is. The first thing I'd like to express is that this is not Minecraft, and it is not Roblox. It is different from those. This is a completely different game. You can build actual lego builds using this, and it has a friendly "eventing system", which is essentially programming, which lets you bring interactivity to your buildings.  I think this is a good game, it has a generally nice community, and it has a range of servers for you to choose from. There are also quite a few mods in the game, and new mods are developed pretty often. I definately reccomend it if you enjoy sandbox or building type games.

content:
er 24, 2013
												This game is disliked for one reason: because it is compared to Minecraft and Roblox, two very popular building games. Now, comparing this game to Minecraft is like comparing cows to pigs. It really doesn't make sense except for them being in the same category of game genres. I can see how you would compare this game to Roblox, but even then there are a LOT of differences. Roblox might be better in a way that you can have groups, dress easily, and what you can do on Roblox is limitless. But, Blockland is also limitless. One of the good parts about Blockland, is that it was entirely built by the community and everybody who has it has loved it. Yeah, it will continue having updates, but those updates won't change how fun Blockland is and it's style of gameplay. Hell, who cares if Blockland doesn't have groups, you can make your own that is based on Roleplaying, military, and so on. The skin designer is really easy to use and you can make some awesome decals for your shirt, pants, head, and everywhere. I recommend Blockland to anyone at the price it is at, because in my opinion, it is one hell of a game.

content:
r 9, 2014
												Blockland is one of those games where it is what you make of it. There is no floor, and no ceiling for how good this game is, and how good it can be. I've had this game for about ten years now, and have played it for at least a month each year, and plenty more inbetween, although it has grown old for me now, it will always be my first and most favorite sandbox game of all time, with an add-on system rivaled only by Garry's mod you can't really go wrong with it.Despite having a rather toxic community that ressemble that of LoL and Dota, it actually has a very friendly add-on sharing community, where people often take requests and listen to feedback. The servers range from absolute ♥♥♥♥ to games within games, showing how diverse, yet repetitive a game can be, and having such a robust building system it opens a gateway to many, if not infinite, ways of producing content for yourself and the community.

content:
, 2014
												This pains me to even type up such a review, becuase I've played Blockland way back in 2008, along with Roblox, which used to be my crack. While Roblox is now a slot machine, it still maintains to update itself in such a fashion. Its now more sleek and modern that Blockland here, and that normally wouldn't be a problem, but the problem is that this the year of 2014.I'm not saying that you can't release games like Shovel Knight, but from playing Blockland in 2008, to actually buying it on Steam in 2014, not a single damn thing has hardly been changed/updated. The only major updates have actually removed cult hit maps due to "incompatibilities". Guys, thats the equlivent of Garry completly removing construct from GMod... but again, it still wouldn't matter. Why? The whole reason why Blockland has failed: Community. You see, if Garry decided to remove famous content, the COMMUNITY would be like "Time to fire up some Source SDK" in  Blockland? Nope.To site an excellent review from DarkByte97;"The community for this game is virtually nonexistant (unless you're dying to be in a commuinty full of autocratic ♥♥♥♥♥). I have not seen a gaming community full of more hostile and irrational people in my life. This is why all of our servers have nothing good."Amen brother. Server after server, you'll meet some very arrogent people within the "community". Want to find some advice on subject matters that genuinely need answering? "Lol Roblox feg go frack urself lawl go suck Builderman's stud loL!!11!" The community sites Roblox as a terrible game, yet does nothing for their beloved game to actually help stand out against a superior platform for block building. What about Gameplay? Surely thats half-way decent... Building is... absolutley awful. Where you have a entire keyboard and mouse to use to construct your "uber amazing" projects, you use a numpad... its a awkard and seemingly unnecessary game mechanic to learn. Why can't I just simply right click to place a block? No, you HAVE to use the numpad, and if you don't, then you're too stupid. Again, age has been an absolute ♥♥♥♥♥ to this game, so clunky controls come with it.EDIT 1: You can rebind keys if you find the numpad off settingWhat about mods? Yeah, it supports them, and there are some good ones out there... on a site that shut down a couple of months ago. Yup. Awesome right? There are archives out there however, but still isn't as great as RTB.But hands down, the WORST part about Blockland is not the game itself, as old as it may be, but what surrounds it. The developer's complete ignorance and the communities lazy boy style of support, there's no water in Blocklands well, and its a damn shame becuase it has such amazing potential. I got lucky, I only bought this for a buck or two during the summer sale, but it was hardly worth that. If "Badspot" even decides to update Blockland with Steam Workshop, (he said he would, but that was a long time ago) maybe we'll see some cool stuff, and that the Steam community will do what the ocean did to Atlantis, and layer over the arrogent Blocktards, and shove some fire into Blockland's cold, dead heart.

Product received for free
												Wow. I never actually thought that I'd see a building game that got my attention. The grahpics are amazing, the animations are appealing. But, I have to be honest, the community is just..terrible. Depending on who it is, or where he/she is from, it doesn't make a make a big change or impact on the community. But, appart from that, on single-player its actually pretty peaceful. You can make ideas for your server that you're "going" to make, or just have fun freebuilding. Basically, this game is similar to minecraft but with a different building style. I thought you might want to read this before you actually get into the game, so you have a little notion of what you're doing. The building style uses the Numpad keys, 123456789 and 0, the Numpad keys move the brick to where you want it to go, without clicking somewhere and it goes. Overall-review: 9/10. I like the game, but the community just bad. But, I have not listed all the details about Blockland, you can read about it in different reviews. The one "A.W.E.S.O.M -4000" posted is a little more helpful. Thank you for your time.

content:
er 18, 2013
												If you enjoy playing with lego's, this is certainly a game for youBlockland is an non-linear lego-esque sandbox game with no goals or objectives. Instead, you start in an empty world with only your imagination. Players use bricks to construct anything they desire. Houses, castles, spaceships, anything you can think of. The only real limit is the brickcount, which i believe is around 1,000,000 bricks at once. Unless you're some hardcore extreme builder, you'll never hit this limit and you'll be free to build anything you want without worrying about running out of bricks(a common problem found with real life legos).If you don't like building alone, it's very easy to set up a server and have friends join the fun. You could even enter a public freebuild server and hangout there.Building not you're style? That's alright, this game has multiple gamemodes aka multiple ways of playing the game. Challenge some friends to a kart race, or join a deathmatch server and show off your mad MLG no-scoping skills. Team up with other players to defeat a powerful boss. Escape from prison while avoiding police brutality. Enter a city rp, empires rp, slave rp,or, everyone's favorite roleplay, the family rp. If none of that sounds interesting, you could always try to make your own gamemode and contribute to the community.Speaking of communtity content, the blockland forums is filled with countless amounts of add ons and new content to spice up your game. Download some new weapons, get a new car, fly a stunt plane. If you're a builder, there's tons of custom bricks and tools to make building easier and more fun.A lot of reviews here seem to warn you about the game's community to some extent. I'll be honest, there are some pretty bad people in the game, particlularly on the forums. However there are lots of cool people aswell to meet in game and on the forums, and that's not so bad.THE VERDICT:I spent $20 on this game before it's steam release, and probably have 500 hours on that version. Now it's only $10, so it's even more worth it. And when it goes on sale, you should have no reason not to buy this wonderful game.So, why are you reading this review and not buying/playing this game? Get it now, you won't regret it.

number of helpful: 7 of 13 people (54%) found this review helpful7 people found this review funny
content:
, 2016
												tl;dr don't touch this game with a 10 foot pole.To start- Personal Problems- Gameplay Problems- The ForumsBefore you readI cannot recommend this game. Before I start this off, I'd like to address the 1,000 hours thing. Most of my hours are from either from me leaving the game open for my friends (partially due to the fact that blockland on steam has no dedicated support, and lacking a client made me deal with doing this for a bit), dealing with my friends playing this game, or actually enjoying 1-2 gamemodes that are put out on the game that are pretty much non existent now. I have a love hate relationship with this game, you can make something done so well, working through the games pretty dated limitations, to be utterly destroyed by the community in any way possible, because if one problem is apparent, then everyone will try to exploit and break the system you've created. I mean sure that can go for everything, right? Well not like how the community treats it. You're the bad guy if the system is partially flawed, not the people actively trying to break your system. I have been on the fence of making this review for a good 6 months or so, mostly due to how I feel about the game and the community as said from above.Personal Problems inbound, Community TooOh, I know you! You're that jerk on the forum who hosted that one server!I don't think I want to host it ever again with how the community lashed out at me, it doesn't matter if I'm the victim at this point, here's my reasoning for why I say this: If you look at the previous works with my friends, I'm not involved, I'm not claiming to make everything, I'm trying to stay away from the spotlight because I outright don't deserve it. That's why I'm not the poster for these things, I'm not handling hosting an the event, and I'm not in charge of most of what's happening. I'm not in charge of any of this ♥♥♥♥ other than posting updates (which I didn't even do entirely), the formatting for threads, and music for our events. I don't want to pin the blame on others, because they don't deserve it, but this was outrageous. Now, during the event one of our events broke, spamming music. You know what we had to do? Restart the server. Oh, it's a tragedy, right? How dare we restart the server because something I HAD NO CONTROL OVER, broke. You know what happens then? a good 50+ people start collectively ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ on me when again, I HAD NO CONTROL OVER IT. I had blame pinned on me for no reason, and the community is downright ignorant.Oh, but you act like a prick!!I don't want to take part in the community for the most part anymore, if I ever go on the game again it's because of my friends motives, and anything I do towards the community I do if I really feel like it's needed. I'm not saying my actions back in the past are justified because I hate the image I made for myself, but if nobody is willing to give me even a chance to act like a competent person then why even try? If I come back under a different name, people will find who I am and continue ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ on me for something I did. It's not even worth my time, either. I don't want to deal with a community that actively attacks people in and outside of the community if they have a disability, I don't want associate with a community that acts this awful towards people, it's petty. I understand  I haven't been the best person around in the community, but even if I decided to change, nobody would give a ♥♥♥♥. It's easier to act like a ♥♥♥♥ back unprovoked and act ignorant because that would get someone banned faster.If you hate the community, why have you been apart of it for so long?I have just outright tolerated it, but it has been the forum that has kept a lot of people towards the game for awhile, and getting off of it has been a hard time, but finally saying I don't want anything to do with that place anymore feels welcoming due to how awful the community can be sometimes. Toleration doesn't mean that I like it, though. I have just put up with the community, nothing more, nothing less until recently.Gameplay ProblemsWhat do you mean 1-2 gamemodes you've enjoyed? Wouldn't you recommend the game for that?I have 1,000 hours on this game, I've played a majority the game has to offer, and I'm not going to be the generic "the game isn't fun anymore" type of person. You have to actively sift through the ♥♥♥♥ on the master list to find games that are actually enjoyable, and a good 90% of the time there's nothing to offer. By the chance there is something fun to play, the community again attacks whatever me or my friends do because we're a group of like 6-7 people at a time. You know, because that many people is threatening and if we have power that one person has to constantly annoy us because they want to "join us" and mess everything up, and when they don't get their way they throw a ♥♥♥♥♥ fit and attack us whenever they can. This has happened so many times it's just outright ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. I'm sick and tired of this happening constantly.What do you mean limited?The game came out like 10 years ago, the game is limited and has not had a big update in what, three years?! (3/13/17) What's there to play for? Nothing will be new and the community isn't treating the game that well either.One mistake? How so?The game is overall broken, there is so much broken to the point of where you can get out of maps that you have built. For example, you build something in a cube format, you can glitch and jump out through the walls and has never been fixed. You have to use zonebricks as a solution to this, and the downside to that? No water bricks. The game is also very very broken. If you sat down to play speedkart for an hour, I assure you that you have been shot away by the awful physics at least 5 times at a minimum. You have to work in the games awful limitations, and fix the games awful problems to manage to host one thing decent, mess up something or don't lock it down fully? Don't expect your server up for more than an hour.Oh, but you still enjoyed it!That doesn't mean I'll ever want others to play this game. Just because I have the patience to sit through and sift through god awful gamemodes is beyond the normal persons attention span.Deny it all you want, the community is declining. (Community plays a heavy role)Sorry to break it to everyone, but Blockland isn't what it used to be. I joined pretty late compared to others, but heck even in my time there were fun servers up with stuff to do. Now there's what, one or two (two if you're lucky) servers with over 20 people? It's hilarious. If you're playing it today and you're keeping your projects private/not releasing them, you're doing just as much as the people complaining about the game dying. Sorry to be blunt but that's the harsh truth.The ForumsThis is just going to be a small touch to this but, never join the forums. The forums are one of the worst places on the internet, never get involved with the people there.It's not a joke how bad the forums are.People are serious with how bad they are. Don't join to find out, just don't even go to the website. Stay as far away from it as possible. It is the epitome of a ♥♥♥♥ community.To conclude, I think the community does not play good service for the game, and I can tell you first hand that a good majority of the people in game are less than pleasant. Now that doesn't mean everyone is bad, there are some people that are actually worth talking to, but it's a minority.Edit 3/13/17: I split my problems between myself and the game itself, follow what you wish.

content:
er 16, 2013
												I've had this game for many years even before it was on Steam, and I am overjoyed that it is now here. This game is worth it, and will be a long time before you get bored as long as you are imaginative and have friends to play with. Infact, I met most of my steam friends because of this game. The game has an "environment" system in which the textures for the skybox (skybox textures also will load their own lighting settings) and ground can be changed, a day and night cycle can be applied, water or lava can be added with customizability to the water level, as well as changes to the view distance and fog distance are possible. There are also a lot of Add-Ons for this game, which have impressive stability (Add-Ons are Found on These Forums: https://forum.blockland.us/index.php.) You can literally have 150 or more different Add-Ons made by different people, even some for older versions of Blockland, and they will continue to work with basically no problems at all. Try saying that for GMod where I can manage to have the game crash with less than 50 add-ons together.This game is certainly worth it however my only gripe with it is the lack of Linux support but even that is barely needed since it quite literally runs flawlessly on Linux using Wine versions 1.7 and up without a hickup ever.

content:
7, 2014
												This is marked as a negative for only a few reasons of that of which I'm going to explain. First off, I saw this game around its older and more golden years. I saw the mods, the weapons, the missions, the GUI features and the many things that the community were throwing in and everyone was loving it! I wanted Blockland. Badly. Unfortunately, I could not get it until its Steam release. But only now as I buy this, I find out that RTB is closing down and maps have been removed. This was a huge disappointment to me and those who wanted to play alone at their free will and explore and do missions that people would create. Now, don't get me wrong. This game is awesome and a ton of fun. But its strongest hole is the bad timing of things I wanted to try like everyone else around its golden age. Steam, I can only pray and hope that you will return a better community that are worthy to make the perfect addons. Again, this is much like the same issue Garry's mod had. When I saw Gmod, it looked amazing and fantastic. I played Gmod 12 and loved it all. That was when at the very cut second Gmod 13 was released and I lost that feature. Blockland....Please don't fail like Gmod did. Just do what everyone else wants. Addons and maps again. That is all I want. Other then that, this game is worth getting if you love to have a lot of freedom. But if you are one who has seen Blockland in its older ages before the steam release, you are likely better off waiting but if you want, its likely worth it to buy this anyways for the simple fact of its fun little multiplayer servers.
